documents.document: This #HandHygieneDay, we call on health workers facilities to ensure effective hand hygiene at all points of care. #HandHygiene: Protects health workers Protects patients Protect communities https://t.co/90I3ZOGN7t

Investing in access to water, sanitation hygiene services is a simple cost-effective way of saving lives! #HandHygiene prevents up to 50% of avoidable infections acquired during health care delivery. #HandHygieneDay https://t.co/aOr31gEoza

Today is #HandHygieneDay - a reminder that "seconds save lives." #HandHygiene is one of the most effective ways to prevent the spread of infections, including #COVID19. This year, WHO calls on all health workers facilities to ensure safe hand hygiene at all times. https://t.co/y8PsuRupfW
RT @WHOEthiopia: Its #HandHygiene Day 2021! Seconds save lives! #CleanYourHands #InfectionPrevention https://t.co/J4nCWQ2GQZ
RT @WHOBotswana: #DYK that #AntimicrobialResistance makes infections harder to treat or even incurable? Don't abuse antibiotics. https://t

Just nine days outbreak was declared in #Guinea, #Ebola vaccinations began with support of @WHO partners. WHO is also supporting with medical equipment supplies such as cold chain, testing screening materials. No new cases have been recorded since 2 April. https://t.co/lQUpJsDhQ3

#Ebola surveillance preparedness are also being ramped up across #Guinea's six neighbouring countries cross-boarder transmission remains a risk due to travel trade. Hundreds of Liberian traders use the Ganta crossing point to visit a weekly market in Guinea. https://t.co/FDYVIpa6QP

WHO partner organizations are also working with community leaders in #Guinea so they take ownership of the #Ebola response support public education. Community involvement has proven to be critical in curbing Ebola. https://t.co/yN9JUXu5Gb

#Guinea declared an #Ebola outbreak on 14 February after cases were confirmed in NZerekore. Health authorities swiftly mounted a response with @WHO support. Surveillance screening networks have been set up to quickly detect stop the spread of the virus. https://t.co/iIeZK5ZWzF

Huge efforts have been made to curb #Guinea's #Ebola outbreak building on expertise gained in 20142016 outbreak. Guinean health workers community leaders have been at the forefront of the response with support of @WHO partners. Our photo storyhttps://t.co/pDd3xh7YaW https://t.co/HFBR0kMBks
RT @WHONigeria: Please DON'T self-medicate. If you feel unwell see a licensed medical practitioner. #AMR https://t.co/1AHGp8RwD3
RT @WHONigeria: #DYK that #AntimicrobialResistance makes infections harder to treat or even incurable? Don't abuse antibiotics. https://t.
Keep yourself safe from #COVID19 this #Ramadan. Wash your hands often Wear a mask Keep a safe distance Avoid large gatherings or events #RamadanMubarak https://t.co/Zw2FwLvQSD

ANTIMICROBIAL RESISTANCE. Its a global health crisis threatening 4.1 million lives in #Africa by 2050. #AMR makes common illnesses untreatable as bacteria, parasites viruses mutate become resistant to medicines. #ResistAMR https://t.co/iS0xAb5ZmA https://t.co/OWTEZPtXt6
RT @MoetiTshidi: We cannot be lulled into a false sense of security. The devastating surge of #COVID19 cases deaths in India, increases
RT @WHOBotswana: Antimicrobial Resistance #AMR could kill 4.1 million people in #Africa 2050. When we abuse, misuse or overuse medicines
RT @WHOSouthSudan: When we abuse, misuse or overuse medicines like antibiotics, antivirals, antifungals antiparasitics, we risk bugs beco
Dr @MoetiTshidi shares an epidemiological update of the #COVID19 pandemic in #Africa words of caution as risk of a surge in cases remains. https://t.co/UjdnspjhP7
RT @MoetiTshidi: Heartfelt congratulations to the people of #DRC for ending the latest #Ebola outbreak! Huge credit to the expertise of l
RT @MoetiTshidi: We have been pleased to support @MinSanteRDC's efforts to bring this outbreak under control, including contact tracing, tr

Teams remain on high alert as #DRC health authorities monitor for potential #Ebola flare-ups in the months to come. @WHO continues to work with health authorities to tackle other public health problems, including outbreaks of measles, cholera #COVID19. https://t.co/iYfM1hjYtn

The #Ebola response was coordinated by the Provincial Department of Health in collaboration with @WHO partners. WHO had nearly 60 experts on the ground supporting contact tracing, providing treatment, community engagement vaccination. https://t.co/mGX37nNTfp

The latest #Ebola outbreak in #DRC has been declared over after just 3 months. Twelve cases, six deaths six recoveries were recorded in four health zones in North Kivu during this outbreak. @WHO congratulates DRCs swift response to this outbreak! https://t.co/2gNHJR22B6 https://t.co/hNZ1moYLaT

Antimicrobial Resistance #AMR could kill 4.1 million people in #Africa by 2050. When we abuse, misuse or overuse medicines like antibiotics, we risk bugs becoming RESISTANT to the medicines used to fight them. We must #ResistAMR More info: https://t.co/iS0xAb5ZmA https://t.co/qBhoTAENG7

GOOD NEWS from #DRC! @MinSanteRDC has just announced the end of the 12th #Ebola outbreak in DRC just 3 months after the first case was reported in North Kivu. Congratulations to health authorities, health workers communities for this effort. https://t.co/JeTs051A0P
Keeping healthy helps your body to fight infections like #COVID19. Quit tobacco Avoid alcohol Be physically active Eat a healthy diet https://t.co/pPEJXt390d
#DYK that smokers are 1.5x more likely to get severe cases of #COVID19? Say #NoTobacco https://t.co/avkdjasf7u

People with non-communicable disease have a higher risk of severe #COVID19. The main risks of #NCDs are: Tobacco. Alcohol. Air pollution. Unhealthy diet. Physical inactivity. Let's #BeatNCDs. https://t.co/5LOSCDokFF

Stay active this weekend! The health benefits of a physically active lifestyle during adolescence include: improved cardiorespiratory muscular fitness bone and cardiometabolic health positive effects on weight Lets #Be Active! Lets #BeatNCDs! https://t.co/D8rkPZuTAs
#DYK that #COVID19 is transmitted by droplets that spread when we talk, sneeze or cough? Wearing a mask creates a physical barrier that catches these droplets. #MaskUp https://t.co/FrP8j3LH2o

#Africa crossed a historic milestone when it was certified as free of wild #polio last year. Vaccination drives, reaching up to 220 million children multiple times a year, made a huge impact. Dr Tunji Funsho shares lessons from ending wild polio https://t.co/5wmAXq8wHN
#DYK Every $1 spent on childhood immunizations in Africa returns $54 in economic benefits. Vaccines are a smart investment. #AVW2021 #VaccinesWork https://t.co/U92tWsXUgI

#DYK in 2019, 20 million children worldwide more than 1 in 10 missed out on basic vaccines? In Africa, 1 in 5 children remain unprotected. Expanding access to vaccines is key for people everywhere to reach their full potential. #AVW2021 https://t.co/hm7Cv6hDTU
RT @WHOMalawi: Access to immunization connects families with health care systems and brings us all closer to universal health coverage by 2
RT @WHOEthiopia: Happy#GoodFriday. This Ethiopian Easter Festive, stay alert to protect yourself others from#COVID19. Your health

Today is the final day of Africa Vaccination Week #AVW2021 a reminder of the power of vaccines. Vaccines save 4 million lives every year protect us from deadly diseases. #VaccinesWork https://t.co/EoTOsjrVAo

The risk of #COVID19 resurgence remains high in several African countries due to poor adherence to public health measures, mass gatherings, low testing vaccination rates. Essential health services are still reeling from disruptions caused by the pandemic.https://t.co/jxUEm0PbSb

Leaders have the power to ensure that #HealthForAll remains a priority. Strong political will is key to deliver on the promise to reach everyone with life-saving vaccines. This #AVW2021, share this message to call for more action on immunization! https://t.co/wl7qMG0w18
This #AVW2021, stand with us to call for a world where everyone has access to vaccines, for a world where we can all be #ProtectedTogether! https://t.co/YHXKPeSz0V

What does #HealthForAll mean to you? Access to quality essential health care services Access to safe, effective affordable essential medicines Financial risk protection Vaccines for all Strengthening routine immunization is a smart investment! #AVW2021 https://t.co/4CXExdRZKv
In 2020, vaccines helped end a deadly #Ebola outbreak in the Democratic Republic of Congo #DRC. Vaccines bring us closer to an Ebola-free Africa! #AVW2021 #VaccinesWork https://t.co/03zZKTgyzx

"We are encouraging countries to prioritize the first dose, to reach more people, rather than saving supplies for the second dose. It is imperative that the available doses are used as quickly as possible." - Dr @MoetiTshidi

"@WHO is waiting on additional stability data from the Serum Institute of India to determine if the shelf life of #AstraZeneca Covishield doses can be extended from six months to nine months." - Dr @MoetiTshidi
"On Tuesday I met with Ministers of Health in the African Region to discuss key issues, particularly around expiring doses, supply shortages, vaccine safety misinformation." - Dr @MoetiTshidi
"A WHO analysis of 46 African countries finds that almost half are facing a high risk of experiencing a surge in cases. Now is not the time to let our guard down." - Dr @MoetiTshidi

"We cannot be lulled into a false sense of security as the continents case count appears stable. The devastating surge of #COVID19 cases deaths in India, increases in other regions of the world, are clear signs of the risk of resurgence in Africa." - Dr @MoetiTshidi
LIVE: Join our @WHOAFRO #COVID19 press briefing. Dr @MoetiTshidi is joined by experts from across the Region, including Dr Christian Owoo Dr Kaushik Ramaiya. https://t.co/n8AgDEAICT
Vaccines will help us end the #COVID19 pandemic so we can finally be closer to each other again. #VaccinesWork to bring us closer. #WorldImmunizationWeek #AVW2021 https://t.co/1ltCuyPpaG

Its #WorldImmunizationWeek! Vaccination protects people of all ages against preventable diseases is one of the best ways to provide children with a healthy start in life. #VaccinesWork to bring us closer. #AVW2021 https://t.co/CYUGrCyyAC

Here are some of the key lessons emerging from African countries that have made strong progress in #COVID19 vaccine rollout including Angola, Ghana, Mauritius Rwanda. Early insights offer hope, inspiration early, yet vital lessons. #AVW2021 https://t.co/1uBdEzyQ6j

Over 4.5 million confirmed #COVID19 cases on the African continent - with more than 4 million recoveries 120,000 deaths cumulatively. View country figures more with the WHO African Region COVID-19 Dashboard: https://t.co/FKav40Cbdd https://t.co/68AGxBhVlh

No one is safe until everyone is safe. Equitable access to #COVID19 vaccines will help protect health economic gains in all nations - bring all of us closer to the end of the pandemic. #AVW2021 #ProtectedTogether https://t.co/IXsp7csn6x
RT @WHO: #HPV vaccine is highly effective. It can prevent 9 in 10 cases of HPV the #1 cause of cervical cancer. Yes, #VaccinesWork to br
RT @WHO: The #HPV vaccine is available in more than 100 countries around, helping to protect millions of girls against #CervicalCancer. Bu
RT @WHO_Zimbabwe: How much do you know about diabetes Watch to learn more about the causes, symptoms and how it can be treated @MoHC

Don't miss tomorrow's @WHOAFRO #COVID19 press briefing. Dr @MoetiTshidi will be joined by experts from across the Region, including Dr Christian Owoo Dr Kaushik Ramaiya. Thursday 29 April 11AM (GMT+1) https://t.co/R1QBHzOw85 https://t.co/o4ZT7AWFAF

Lack of access to quality data is a major barrier to addressing health the Region. The @WHO integrated African Health Observatory (iAHO) makes health information more available, accessible easier to use. For more info: https://t.co/g9BWWG7IDC https://t.co/Zrvd5sucgS

The @WHOAFRO integrated African Health Observatory (iAHO) is a health information platform that provides a real-time overview of health in the Region. Check out the presentation of the newly redesigned iAHO earlier this month. Watch here: https://t.co/Lu7yX7U7Od https://t.co/9nYbSWijj7

#DYK that Africa accounts for 16% of the global population, but only 0.1% of the global vaccine production? Advancing RD, manufacturing distribution in #Africa will bring us closer to equitable protection from life-threatening diseases. #AVW2021 https://t.co/6aFBtHel98 https://t.co/lUSp55dp6m

Equitable access to safe effective #COVID19 vaccines will help communities economies thrive. No one is protected until we are all protected, stand up for #VaccinEquity! #ProtectedTogether #AVW2021: https://t.co/6aFBtHel98 https://t.co/24D8c0lhLI

#COVID19 vaccines offer crucial protection against severe disease, hospitalisation death from the virus. They bring us all closer to ending the pandemic. #AVW2021 #ProtectedTogether #VaccinesWork https://t.co/6aFBtHel98 https://t.co/KubVnRPz4k

Pandemic preparedness response must be equitable to be effective. Join panellists including @WHOAFROs @Patuhebwe for this @harvardGH discussion on making equity a strategic priority in future health crises. Thurs 29 April 3:00-4:00pm (CAT) https://t.co/Ho3gKeaiIb https://t.co/vYynLyMztm
RT @MoetiTshidi: Farewell to my sister Micaela Marques de Sousa @UNICEF Representative in Congo. Appreciate the opportunity to thank you
RT @USAIDGH: Vaccines bring us closer to a more prosperous ! @USAIDs investments in #COVAX will play a critical role in reinvigorating ou
RT @gavi: The vaccine is cheap, safe and saves lives. We will not lose our lives because we are not vaccinated - Angola is celebrating th

Here are some of the key lessons emerging from African countries that have made strong progress in #COVID19 vaccine rollout including Angola, Ghana, Mauritius Rwanda. Early insights offer hope, inspiration early, yet vital lessons. #AVW2021 https://t.co/aUWnaghVuQ
RT @MoetiTshidi: Productive meeting with @ChrisJElias last week on @WHOAFRO priority programmes which have been advancing thanks to @gate

Reflecting on #COVID19 in Africa: One Year Later with @VOANews Straight Talk Africa. Join @WHOAFROs @Patuhebwe other experts looking back on one year of pandemic response on the continent. #VOACoronavirusAfrica Wednesday 28 April 3:30pm CAT https://t.co/nG6sgSqHyP https://t.co/j2KpjFRAO0

Over 4.5 million confirmed #COVID19 cases on the African continent - with more than 4 million recoveries 120,000 deaths cumulatively. View country figures more with the WHO African Region COVID-19 Dashboard: https://t.co/FKav40Cbdd https://t.co/bXBId46kso
RT @MoetiTshidi: Pleasure joining briefing today on #COVID19 vaccine rollout with Ministers of Health from the Region. Productive discussio

With most African countries rolling out #COVID19 vaccines, what are the emerging challenges seen? Join @UNICEF @GAVI @WHOAFRO Health Ministries for tomorrows webinar on Africa's #COVID19 vaccine rollout. 28 April 10am12pm (GMT+1) Register: https://t.co/CVtDaIfAew https://t.co/jhhf1dzv9v

#DRC's #YellowFever vaccination campaign is led by health authorities, with support of @WHO, @Gavi, @PATH, @UNICEF, @VillageReach other partners. It has taken more than a year of planning was partly delayed due to the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/uT4ql8jSCj

#DRC just launched a preventive #YellowFever vaccination campaign targeting more than 16.3 million people, including nearly 300,000 refugees. This drive against the disease is the first in #Africa this year. #AVW2021 https://t.co/YqHEuyuUvm https://t.co/ZbBxgATua8

Unlike most medicines which treat or cure diseases, vaccines prevent them. This helps keep people communities healthy reduces the strain on health systems. This #AVW2021, speak up and advocate for equitable access to vaccines. #VaccinesWork #VaccinEquity https://t.co/Pl6AeoKqHM
5 tips to ensure #COVID19 safety at places of worship mosques this #Ramadan. #RamadanMubarak https://t.co/6gDmnBl3B6

Over 4.5 million confirmed #COVID19 cases on the African continent - with more than 4 million recoveries 120,000 deaths cumulatively. View country figures more with the WHO African Region COVID-19 Dashboard: https://t.co/FKav40Cbdd https://t.co/7rhQR67JkW
RT @WHOGAMBIA: #HappeningNow! Dr Desta Tiruneh, #WHO Representative in The #Gambia hands over the #Trachoma elimination letter from @DrTedr

#DYK that 1 dose of the yellow fever vaccine gives life-long immunity against the disease? We must push for high immunization coverage to protect people from #YellowFever other vaccine-preventable diseases. #VaccinesWork #ProtectedTogether https://t.co/Iw9kny7pVU
RT @OMS_Afrique: Rejoignez les leaders africains de la sant et les champions de la vaccination pour clbrer comment "les vaccins nous rap

Vaccines eradicate diseases, save lives prevent disability In 2020 the @WHOAFRO region was declared free of wild poliovirus, an inspiring sign that shows #VaccinesWork. With greater immunization efforts, we can fight against all forms of polio! #EndPolio #AVW2021 https://t.co/WbTjMAk5Kk
LIVE: Join African health leaders immunization champions in celebrating how Vaccines Bring Us Closer. #AVW2021 https://t.co/a0qY2aFZ1I

This #AVW2021 we call for more, better action to ensure every generation in #Africa is protected from vaccine-preventable diseases. #COVID19 has significantly disrupted routine immunization services, leaving many at risk. #ProtectedTogether #VaccinesWork https://t.co/YOa775mHTV
Dr Phionah Athuebwe from @WHOAFRO explains why the #COVID19 vaccine is still important even if youve already had COVID-19. #ViralFactsAfrica https://t.co/WwqM03yY2V
RT @WHO: #AskWHO on @TwitterSpaces: #3 Session: How can we #EndPolio? @Dr_HamidJafari @NayyarUjala 12:00 PM CEST #WorldImmunizati

Today is the launch of Africa Vaccination Week live from Accra, Ghana with @MOHGhana and @WHOAFRO @WHOGhana. Join African health leaders immunization champions in celebrating how Vaccines Bring Us Closer. #AVW2021 10:0012:00 (GMT) Live Streaming @WHOAFRO @mohgovgh https://t.co/pp9tLXlDMT
RT @WHOGhana: #Malaria kills nearly 400,000 people every year in the African Region, yet it is preventable, curable. We must ensure tha
RT @WHOAFRO: Can we end #malaria as a public health threat? The simple answer is YES. 4 African countries have already achieved #ZeroMal

Innovations will be critical to speed up progress towards #ZeroMalaria. So, we are excited that Ghana, Kenya Malawi have delivered more than 1.7 million doses of the RTSS #MalariaVaccine - a promising additional tool in malaria prevention. https://t.co/As7FOLENY3 https://t.co/1JvvPNbYIC

Cabo Verde is one of four African countries that have gone for three consecutive years malaria transmission. The country is now eligible to apply for @WHO's certification of #malaria elimination. #WorldMalariaDay https://t.co/FTsBTWDSMn

Today, we are celebrating 2 years of the #MalariaVaccine. Lusitana was the first child in the world to receive the RTS,S malaria vaccine through routine immunization. She has now received all four doses is fully vaccinated. #WorldMalariaDay https://t.co/SLXr9lKdJO
Can we end #malaria as a public health threat? The simple answer is YES. 4 African countries have already achieved #ZeroMalaria status for 3 years. #WorldMalariaDay https://t.co/IrSxZxrG9d

2 years ago, #Malawi became the first country to introduce the malaria vaccine into its childhood immunization programme. Clara is one of many mothers who were eager to protect their children against #malaria, a major cause of death. #WorldMalariaDay https://t.co/zygYj3PZkk

Join the official launch of Africa Vaccination Week on Monday 26 April! Hosted by @MOHGhana, @WHOAFRO @WHOGhana with African health leaders immunization champions. #AVW2021 #ProtectedTogether #VaccinesWork Monday 26 April 10:0012:00 GMT Live Streaming @WHOAFRO @mohgovgh https://t.co/UBUuUAzDsq
